review.reviewBody:
All in all its a good bergen so I'm just focussing on the things that I'm a bit irrittated by.
The straps squeak, which I'm getting used to blocking out.
The waist pocket zips are not easy to close they do not slide easily and must be wiggled to close on the move.
Why oh why did you make that side strap red. Only an issue for tactical use I admit. Out with the fabric dye!
The rain cover doesn't cover enough of the bergen and definetly not if you have a sleep matt fitted. It leaves large openenings at the side for rain to collect inside the cover.
Even with the back set to largest the shoulder straps do not come far enough over my shoulders for the perfect fit. Nearly but not quite there on someone 196cm but with average not Marine standard upper body coondition.
The side stuff pockets cant be accessed on the move as the compression strap tensionsare over the top of them. I could run with the straps a bit loose but then wouldn't have the confidence that items wouldn't fallout because they have a large acces point at the bottom. They would have been better off lower opening to guarantee the contents security. I would have to take the bergen off to access the contents but at least I would be certain things were still there. Above the snow line I can't afford to stuff my hatt and snow mitts in and HOPE they stay there. Water bladder space hook is too low and given the width of the bladder pocket they would have been better off putting 2 hooks in so that I could put 2xslim camelbak bladders in. This comment is probably more about the fact that there are no bladders on the market that properly utilise bladder pockets on any bergens I have looked at. When fully loaded the pack centre of gravity is too far back from the spine. I would have preffered a wider main body or detachable large side packs rather than the big lump added to the rear.
review.name: Comfortable but squeaky and poor for access on the move.

review.reviewBody:
First of this is a very good pack and can handle a heavy load.. 
But it's also a bit of everything; travelling pack, multi day pack. Experdision pack? 

While the fit on the fly carry system is exultant and the padding is very comfortable there a lot of unnecessary Weight in this 3.4kg for an experdision pack. 
Could easily louse 1kg from between the hood and zips etc.. then this would be a fantastic multi week expedition pack. 

All that said still one of the best out there...
review.name: Trying to please everyone

review.reviewBody:
I was excited about this bag, especially as it's difficult to find large bags this right now. While yes, it is covered under the lifetime gurantee, and I will be sending it in to be fixed, I busted the plastic tightening strap on the rightside MAIN backpack strap, immediately after opening it, with literally no weight in the pack. It's clear that Osprey not only saved a buck designing this bag in the cheap plastic clips they've attached, but they also designed the strap to be unusable without it.

I would rather have spent this ridiculous amount of money on two smaller bags at Dueter. I'm profoundly displeased.
review.name: Busted clip immediately after opening

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] By far the best pack I’ve purchased! We’ll designed, very comfortable to take long hikes with and durable as well. I was able to fit everything I needed plus more for my winter backpacking trips. It was a grate gift idea too!
review.name: By far the best pack

review.reviewBody: I've had this pack for 4+ years now. I take it on a couple backpacking trips a year on average and some day hikes where I'm carrying more than normal. It's always fit everything I need. I've carried a large tandem packraft and paddles with it (alpacka forager). I've hiked 30 miles of the Kesugi Ridge Trail with it. The most notable use I think was for a caribou hunt I did a couple years ago on the Denali Highway. I packed out a cow caribou including all meat and 4 quarters bone in and the hide with my other knives and day pack type gear 5 miles down a mountain side and back to the parking lot via the trail. Roughly 100lbs. No buckles broke or came undone under tension, no rips, straps worked well to keep the load secure and close to my body. It only creaked and groaned a bit under that load, but otherwise performed well especially for not being a hunting pack. I would buy again!
review.name: Hunting Pack!

review.reviewBody: 66 yr old short woman, and I love the ease of this pack and the great comfort of the carry. I like a bear vault, and no trouble packing it in this. Makes it easy to deal with winter layers and days of food. All my gear is ultralight except this pack, and I don't mind the weight when it comes with comfort and stability.
review.name: Adore this pack.

name: Aether Plus 100L Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It doesn’t stay on to cove the bite valve. So it’s pointless and useless.
review.name: It doesn’t stay on to

review.reviewBody: These new bite valves for the hydraulics reservoirs don’t click in like the previous generation. The cover constantly falls off. Needs a redesign unfortunately.
review.name: Your old design was better

review.reviewBody: I have the newest generation hydrualics reservoir and the bit valve cover is simply loose. It is not a snug fit as advertised. Even though the bite valve box clearly mentions the compatibility.
review.name: Doesn’t fit.

review.reviewBody: I have a Hydraulics LT 2.5L (~2022) with original bite valve (not this new one) and it is not compatible. That’s fine. Havent tested it with the new valve, but I guess I have to get one now… the problem is that the advertising is false! The packaging says that it is compatible with Hydraulics. That’s why I bought it in the store. If Hydraulics LT is a different thing, they need to say so! Or fix their product branding if they’re making their new line incompatible with the old line.
review.name: Does not fit on old models

review.reviewBody:
The ONLY way to get this thing on is to soak the hose end (with the mouthpiece) in hot water... that makes the hose pliable enough to pull off. If it isn't working, let it sit longer or make the water hotter. (I had to microwave the water for about 2 minutes.) After sliding on the cover, soak the hose again in the same hot water. I opted to shake off the excess water. Immediately, slide it back onto the mouthpiece all the way up - as far as it goes. 
Also, I have no idea how the hot water will affect the mouthpiece... so after I slid it on and put it back together, I did not touch it. So the materials can cool without warping. (In theory.)

Only Complaint:
There are zero instructions on the box. 

GOOD LUCK!

Note: I have the new Osprey Hydraulics 3L. (2024)
review.name: Use HOT water to get the hose off

review.reviewBody: I have the newest hydration reservoir system (Osprey CS please don’t attribute the lack of fitting to this issue) and this cover does not fit. It’s not a nice snug fit like my last system. Time to go back to the drawing board Osprey.
review.name: Does not fit (particularly with NEW systems)

review.reviewBody: I can't find any instructions online on how to install the Hydraulics Bite Valve Cover. There was no info on the box. How do I install this please?
review.name: Bite cover

name: Hydraulics Bite Valve Cover

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT Low UltraDry Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have worn so many different hiking shoes/boots over the years and have struggled to find something that I really like.  I love these Talus ATs.  My feet are a little bit wide and these are the perfect width for me. They are sturdy and there was no break in period for me. The insoles are basic so I put in my own insoles and they are super comfortable. I have been wearing these shoes for 6 months and probably wear them 5x a week, whether for hiking or to work.
review.name: Love these shoes!
comment: Thank you for your review! We’re happy to hear your shoes are working well for you. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT Low UltraDry Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have had 3 pairs of these shoes ( older models)  and was hoping to replace them with this one. BUT, this shoe design does not fit well. The design of the tongue ( w/ unnecessary extra fabric fold) creates a bulky pressure on foot, in addition to other fit / material issues. I've been searching for a replacement to no avail, and I'm overall disappointed. Designers please look at previous designs & material specs. thanks!
review.name: Needs redesign
comment: Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear that this shoe design does not fit well. We will forward your comments and suggestions along to the proper channels to see if we can make updates to this model in the future.

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT Low UltraDry Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have purchased Vasque shoes for 4 pairs in a row(over 10 years). The model I usually buy is no longer available. So I went with these. I tried them over winter break and I felt a little hotspot on my right heel. I tried to continue to break in before I was going to do a big, planned hike. I tried changing sock (thicker, thinner, everything in between). I wore them on a big hike and got a horrible blister that took over 3 weeks to fully heal. I have no idea how this works..was it the shoe or something else? I do know that I have never, ever had a blister. It happen on my right heal. Not sure if I buy a whole new pair.
review.name: Bad blister
comment: We are sorry to hear your talus AT shoes are not fitting comfortably. We ask that you please contact us at 1-800-224-4453 so we can further discuss the cause and assist with remedies.

name: Talus AT Low UltraDry Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Vortex Pump Sack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vortex Pump Sack
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Vortex Pump Sack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Super easy to use and it fills my 4" Roamer Sleep Pad fast. I highly recommend it.
review.name: Great way to avoid the huffing and puffing

review.reviewBody: Nemo, your pads are awesome, I have two of them, really some of the best out there today. However this pump sack needs a redesign.  Other pump sacks double as a watertight stuff sack for clothes or other items.  This saves space and weight for ultralight hikers. Can you redesign this so the opening is larger similar to a stuff sack so you can fill it with clothes? Also the adapter to attach to pump up the Nemo pads should be closable.  This would be awesome!
review.name: Needs modifications to double as a Stuff Sack.

review.reviewBody: Hard to want to use this pump sack after using other brands. The opening on this is just too narrow to flick open with the wrists - instead you get a mostly uninflated bag of air...1/3 at best.  Too bad because I love the Nemo Tensor sleeping pad.
review.name: opening too narrow- only 1/3 useful
comment: Thanks for your feedback! The Vortex Pump Sack is designed to be inflated by lightly blowing into the bag from about 6 inches away from the opening. Let us know if you want any further instructions by emailing help@nemoequipment.com.

review.reviewBody: I got one of these with a Tensor sleeping pad. It's nice to have and makes blowing up the pad easier, but I wish it could serve dual use as a stuff sack/dry bag like other manufacturers have. The opening is really too narrow to be useful for this purpose. It's fine for car camping but harder to justify if you are backpacking and trying to shave ounces from your kit.
review.name: Does its job and nothing else

review.reviewBody: This pump sack works perfectly with the Nemo sleeping mats. It folds up nicely and yet also inflates the mat with only a few air loads. Great product. It would be nice if the valve was compatible with other mats, such as the Exped.
review.name: The right pump sack for the job

review.reviewBody: I've always hated inflating my sleeping pad and seeing the condensation collecting...gross! I'm so glad I got this pump sack. It makes inflating easier - without the moisture collecting. It also doubles as a dry sack.
review.name: perfect companion to my Tensor sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: This came with my sleeping pad, winter expeditions require as little moisture as possible entering your sleeping pad (the purpose of these pump sacks is that they pump dry air into the bag and prevent the build up of condensation) this bag defeats that purpose by requiring you to inhale into it. Recommend getting a pad with the interested foot pump for winter expeditions and to avoid condensation.
review.name: Still inflates your sleeping pad with moist air
comment: Hi there! If you blow into the bag slightly from a foot or so away from the opening, you should avoid any condensation issues! Let us know if you want any further instructions by emailing journey@nemoequipment.com.

review.reviewBody: It works as advertised - the pump sack is included in each sleeping pad order, which I was unaware of, so this was essentially an extra and unnecessary purchase.
review.name: Smaller opening, but works fine

review.reviewBody: I have used other manufacturers version and I think this is the best one if but for one issue... Please build this function into your sleeping  mat stuff sack. There should be a reason that the stuff sack cannot also act as an inflation devi e so I have one less item to try to keep track of.
review.name: Better than others, but not the best

review.reviewBody: I received this with my Tensor ultralight sleeping pad.  At first, this looked like a silly gimmick.  Then I read the instructions, tried it and OMG!  It worked fantastic!  How did I ever live without it...
review.name: Silly, I think not!

hasVariant.name: Betty Short Waterproof Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Betty Short Waterproof Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. They are so warm and comfortable.
review.name: Great boot.

review.reviewBody: So comfortable and light yet warm. Exactly what I was looking for
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: I've bought Keen boots exclusively for the past ten years, but sadly, I will no longer do so because the designs and fit have changed for the worse. The foot size is just right for me, but the opening is so small that you can't pull the boots on without getting a hernia. Originally, I had the tall Betty boots (so that snow wouldn't get into the boot), but Keen doesn't offer decently tall winter boots now. Then I bought side-zip faux-fur-collar boots, but the zipper was very, very stiff and completely inadequate for the heavy-duty boot. It became unusable after about three wearings. The zipper pull was so small that it couldn't be gripped even with a pair of lightweight gloves. I paid for a feature that never really worked and have not received any satisfaction from Keen.
review.name: Changed for the Worse

review.reviewBody:
I like the boots so far. They’re a bit stiff but am hoping they will soften! 

I bought them because I could not find my favorite Keen boot which is the ankle high pull on anchorage boot for women anymore. I have been wearing this boot or version of it for more than 25 years. I love them! Now, the boot you are making for women is narrower in the toe, stiffer and less rugged. Please go back to the original style. These are your best boots ever! I wore them in all seasons to walk, hike, muck around..
review.name: Warm, cute, and functional!

review.reviewBody: Rather heavier duty boot than what I was looking for. Sole way too stiff for me. Appearance-wise, seems solid and well made.
review.name: nice but no

review.reviewBody: Bought these early for winter use so it’s a little premature to comment.
review.name: Anxious

review.reviewBody: Haven't had a chance to show them off yet. Waiting for the Snow...
review.name: Cuddle Boots

review.reviewBody: I live in Vermont and have not had a solid pair of snow boots until now! These were comfortable the INSTANT I put them on, no need to break in! I love that I can wear them as casual shoes for running errands and out in the snow!
review.name: Perfect for VT Winters!

review.reviewBody: I'm in love with these boots. I purchase them in November. I have had 2 months to try them. Wow! Tried them in damp weather, slush, mud, ice and snow. Great grip, never ounce did I feel the cold or did my feet felt moist or damp. At first, I had to return them twice. I usually wear size 9/8.5 and I suffer from Plantar Fasciitis. I had to return them 2 times. I order a 9 then 8.5, too big. I finally got an 8, perfect fit. To return, was easy and fast! I feel no pain, my toes have room to move and my feet are always warm and comfy. I walk a lot in the woods, I have a 40lbs dog. For me, it's the perfect winter boot.
review.name: Québec Winter

review.reviewBody: Was hopping for something like the Ella boot from previous seasons- this didn’t quite fit the bill. Not crazy about the look
review.name: Returned

name: Betty Short Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Great jacket, after reading the specs and reviews decided to order the Hemispheres. It's breathable and lightweight, good design and sleeves length and overall length is perfect. Love the color. I'm 5'4, 122 lbs and ordered Size Small.
pros: breathable, lightweight, waterproof, windproof, good design and Fit
review.name: Excellent Jacket

review.reviewBody: The color scheme and fit of this jacket are perfect
review.name: Cutest shell I've ever owned

review.reviewBody: I love how lightweight it is but still super warm! I also really like the fit and how long the back is.
review.name: Awesome Jacket

review.reviewBody: I got this shell in hopes of having a jacket that could be used for "casual" activities (general rain jacket), but also activities like high alpine backpacking (rain/wind protection), cross country skiing, and downhill skiing. I'd say this jacket has lived up to my expectations after a few wears cross country skiing - it's windproof, waterproof, and the features make it exceptionally adaptable. The side ventilation zippers help me vent after I'm warmed up on the trail, and the oversized hood protects every bit of my hair. I love that the sleeve openings are adjustable for my thin wrists. My one complaint is that the interior zipper for essentials does not fit a phone - only the exterior vertical pocket can fit a phone. It's a small gripe though for an otherwise very functional jacket.
review.name: Great weatherproof hard shell, but expensive

review.reviewBody: Great jacket that stays dry all day. Does have some room to wear some layers under it but would say it fits pretty true to size maybe a tad bigger.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Awesome colour! I love all the pocket options inside and outside and the full length pit zips! The length is also perfect for a snowboarder like me when sitting down as it is longer and covers more of the butt. I am 5'7 160 lbs F and ordered a size L so I could layer lots underneath!
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'9, 138lbs, 34D, generally wear S or M. I bought the Small and I'm glad I did because it still runs plenty large - sleeves and overall length work great for my body type. I can layer this with one or two puffers underneath and still be able to move around easily. It has "Performance level Gore-Tex" with stretch. Good amount of pockets that are easy to access & open/close. The hood is easy to adjust and I like the dual zipper on the front.
review.name: Excellent shell, consider sizing down

review.reviewBody: The Hemisphere's jacket is my favorite backcountry ski jacket. It's lightweight and packable, it's waterproof and yet has enough stretch to feel comfortable. The pockets are sized nicely and fit your phone. The hood fits over my helmet, and I have tested this jacket in the worst weather conditions and it holds up to it all. It pair perfectly with the Hemispheres bib, and makes for a high quality, highly technical outerwear. You won't be dissapointed. Fits true to size.
review.name: Favorite Backcountry Skiing Jacket

hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Essential Short Liner - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was overdue for a new liner but have procrastinated this purchase since, frankly, there are things that are much more exciting to spend money on than padded underpants. But I wanted to get this right so I did my research and narrowed my search to 3 candidates: the Terry Aria, Zoic Essential, and POC Essential Short liners. In case you’re at a similar crossroads, I’ll share my impressions and which liner I ultimately chose.

I’m a fit 5’6” woman, ~130 lbs, mid-30’s, with the sturdy upper legs and saddle of a mountain biker. I’m a little more padded than I’d like to be, but petite by most standards. I’m typically a XS/2/26 in street clothes, though after reading reviews claiming that all 3 of these liners ran small, I ultimately ordered a small in the Terry and Zoic shorts and a medium in the POCs. Note that this turned out to be the correct size for me in each short. Here’s how my head-to-head comparison shook out.

POC Essential Liner:
Hands down, these had the best chamois of the bunch. Dense but not bulky padding with a natural shape. I also liked the fabric of the shorts themselves. As promised, it did offer light compression. The shorts were well-shaped and felt like they wouldn’t need to be tugged up all the time. This is the only short of the 3 that has silicone leg grips, if that matters to you. But that is unfortunately where the virtues of these shorts ended. The length and band construction was an unequivocal dealbreaker. With a 2.5-3 inch inseam, the legbands squeezed my thighs at the widest point. And not just a little squeeze…I have never worn a garment that made me feel more grotesquely corpulent. If only these had a longer (7-9 inch) inseam and a wider leg band, I really think my search for the perfect liner would have been over. That said, if you have zero body fat or pin-straight legs, these could be your match…just go up 2 sizes from your street size!

Zoic Essential Liner:
I had high hopes for these given many positive reviews online, but found them unimpressive across the board. The fit was okay, though they are low in front. The chamois was the second densest of the 3 options and seemed like it would be comfortable. The inseam was moderate at around 5-6 inches. The biggest turnoff was the unexpectedly thin fabric that lacked integrity, sort of like a kid’s unlined Lycra swimsuit. There is a band of elastic encased in this material at the top of the yoga-pant-style waist, but it felt strangely rigid in comparison to the thin material. Similarly, the leg band was so much thicker and stronger that the shorts that it created uncomfortable bulging above and below the band. I couldn’t see this fabric standing up well to tugging, heat, sweat, friction, and frequent motion, but if the fit sounds like it could work for your leg shape, it might be worth a look.

Terry Aria Liner: (spoiler: winners!)
Out of the ba, these are the least attractive of the 3 with a high waist, old-school elastic band at the top, perforations all over, and lace bands. You have to pull them on kind of like nylons, by gathering the fabric in your hands, so I was shocked when they slid on like a glove and just felt instantly good everywhere. The chamois is less dense than the other contenders, and I suspect is optimized for road/commuting use, but it’s a quality Italian product with some density over the sit bones and is flexible and breathable. When doing big rides, I haven’t noticed any more soreness than I had in my old, thicker chamois. The shorts slid under my baggies compliantly and don’t slip down or stretch out on the trail. I was concerned the lace bands would be inadequate to hold the legs in place without any silicone grip, but I was wrong. They stay put as well as my old silicone grips plus they’re incredibly comfortable, with no binding or constricted feeling. I’m a fan of the longer inseam. The shorts are very breathable, hold their shape, and hug your curves. They won’t win fashion points but I’m a happy rider!
review.name: Could Have Been Perfect

review.reviewBody: I bought both the med and large the Medium was so so tiny. Kept the large and even at that they are tight and small. I wore them biking and I have to say the padding is really great! but the cut of them is very short and I found them bunching up towards seat the entire time having to keep pulling them down.
review.name: Pretty good

name: Essential Short Liner - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this last month and have skied 20 days in it so far. Only 2 minor bits. The hood and collar are the major ones. With the hood up over a helmet, the front of the hood barely covers my Smith helmet. There should have been a peak with a bit of a bill sticking out over the goggles. Also there is no fleece inside of the high collar so the edge of the collar rubs on your face unless you’re wearing a balaclava to protect your chin. My only other issue, and everone else seems guilty of this these days— no 2 way zipper. I don’t know why companies have abandoned this on shells, but it annoys me. Now the good. The jacket is durable, not noisy, has some nice minor insulation in front, and has good pockets. I enjoy it for skiing but wood enjoy it more with a few simple changes. It didn’t come in many solid colors, though it did come in a few two-tone colors which are not my thing. I would have preferred more solid color choices. I’ 5’10”, 175 lb and got a medium which is just right to allow me to wear a down hoodie under it on cold days.
review.name: Great except…

review.reviewBody: The Patagonia Storm Shift jacket was a disappointment and I sent it back within an hour.  The upper sleeves are not large enough and as a result my fleece was binding in the under arms area.  The hood could not be adjusted tight around my head allowing wind and cold air to enter. Why are all of these ski jackets designed for a helmet to be inside the hood making the hood too big?  The zipper was difficult or impossible to use.
review.name: Patagonia Storm Shift Jacket

name: Storm Shift Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Baltoro 65L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I like this pack but it lacks internal compartments to organize and distribute the weight of your cargo for carrying long distances.  It is basically one big open chamber.
review.name: Good but could be better

review.reviewBody: I enjoy this bag. It was easy to pack/unpack, it felt great on the trail (most if not all weight on my hips). The pockets and waterbottle holder make sense. I had a spot for my camelback bladder which was great. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that I had it right next to the older version of the pack. The one that came standard with a rain cover and small (separate) day pack inside. The overall construction of the bag was mostly the same except the fact that it no longer stands up on it's own when set down on the trail. This is it's major downfall. I tried re-packing my sleeping stuf in the bottom to make it work, and it just doesnt stand on it's own anymore. Not sure what was changed to make this a worse bag, but I think you may want to consider some of the features the bag used to have and make a new hybrid of the two with all things considered. I think a few things got missed this time around. Overall, great pack, but could be better for the price.
review.name: Great pack, could be better.

review.reviewBody:
This is the most comfortable pack I've worn in almost 30 years of backpacking. Love the cushy fit with real padding on the hip belt and shoulder harness. If you have to carry heavier loads, the Baltoros are the way to go. 

The grippy silicone accents on the bottom of the lumbar area should be made standard on all Gregory packs, it helps keep the pack from sliding down really well. The Polygiene is also a game-changer for keeping that trail smell off when you get home. I like the clean design free of stitching/thread on the outside of the pack, and the Alaska Blue color is gorgeous, wish they'd offer that in all their packs. The fabric has held up well without being too heavy, though Gregory needs to stop with the hard parts of the frame at the bottom sides of the pack, covered in a heavier duty material. Though it is thicker there, mine is showing wear and will eventually fail. I see this on a lot of their models (I own 3).

Other improvements should be to get rid of the fold out water bottle holder and put another stretch mesh pocket on the side (that is easy to access with pack on). Many of us don't use Nalgene for backpacking anymore, and dedicating a whole side to such a limited use pocket really kills the space. 
Also on that note, Gregory's stretch mesh should be a better, tighter weave. The current stuff does not inspire confidence. 
Access and organization on this pack are another huge plus, with plenty of space to separate things on, and still get to them. It's not the lightest pack out there, but given its capacity and how well it carries, it's actually not too bad. And you can strip it a bit without the lid and dividers to get down closer to 4 lbs, which isn't bad at all. 

All in all I love it, but just wish Gregory would improve those few things soon before I might need another.
review.name: Super comfortable, but still room to improve...

review.reviewBody: The pack has allot of good features to it that I love but I feel like it could use some simple tweaks to it.  My zipper in the large compartment busted on the first day in France. For sure needs to have bigger zippers considering how much you are able to pack into it.  Thankfully with a few YouTube videos and some tools I was able to make it work again.  The storage size was nice but having a few more little small ones would be nice. Having the top flap able to disconnect quickly would be nice to make it less clumsy.
review.name: Solid travel bag. Needs bigger zippers.

review.reviewBody: This was the first time I upgraded my pack in a long time. I was looking for one with thick and comfortable waist straps, as well as had enough storage for a multi-day hike. I decided to "break it in" on a day hike, but loaded it up with weight and gear to see how it would handle. I was very pleased with the results! Handled well, stayed snug to my body and the storage compartments were perfectly placed. Other additional things that I really like were the easy access water bottle holder on the side, and the zipper "covers" to help prevent any rain/moisture from getting into the bag. Would highly recommend!
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody:
I previously had a Baltoro 75 which I liked, but it had some shortcomings in the adjustability of the pack length and other items. Glad to see they took care of the previous issues.

But they created a new one. They no longer include the waterproof cover with these bags like they did with the last model. I guess shame on me for not making sure it was included like the first bag I bought and shame on Wanderlust Outfitters for not informing me.
review.name: Should Have Been Able To Have Given 5 Stars

review.reviewBody: Took this on a 5 day Yosemite hiking trip. Fit everything I needed and held up well to the rough conditions - and poor treatment from tossing it around - great durability and reliability!
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd Baltoro 65.  My kids keep stealing them as the get big enough.  Love the new upgrades.  Could be lighter, but so could I.
review.name: Excellent pack

review.reviewBody:
I have been an avid camper forever. I was using a Gregory 45 but needed an upgrade for a 2 week adventure in the desert. Well made and very comfortable. 
So far everything has been great. Better fit than my 45 but I can’t wear it while riding my mountain bike. 
The only thing I cannot understand is why my 45 came with a built in rain cover and the 65 doesn’t. 
I initially purchased the osprey but my wife and daughter have them and the “osprey creak” when you walk drove me nuts.
review.name: 3rd Gregory

review.reviewBody: When you forget you are wearing a pack, then someone has done something right!  The suspension system on this pack is phenomenal.  The number of pockets is perfect as it allows the user to get a system in place and access what is needed at a particular time at any time.  This pack is great for anyone who will be carrying heavier loads for longer amounts of time.  Just make sure you  look carefully at the sizing options.
review.name: Great pack!

name: Baltoro 65L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots a little over a year ago.  I was pretty excited because my first pair of Red Wings, Iron Rangers, I've had for probably close to 15 years and they are still going strong.  Those were the boots that turned me on to the brand and I've loved them.  I was pumped to get Mocs and try a different style.  I bought these in store and was measured for them.  I knew there would be a break in period.  But a year later these boots fit pretty poorly.  The heel slip on both feet is still happening.  I still have to use moleskin to have them be comfortable.  Also have to have cushion inserts.  And while I can wiggle my toes in the toe box, the boot on my right foot doesn't have enough give and a year later is still pinching onto my little toe.  The sizing has turned out to be very poor.  Its disappointing because the boots are well made.  They look good when on.  They are just incredibly uncomfortable to the point where I'm questioning if I'll ever get another pair of Red Wings.  And for the price, to just walk away from them is a tough pill to swallow.
review.name: Not a positive, second purchase experience
comment: Thank you for your honest review. We are sorry to hear about the lack of comfort you've received in your boots. We will be reaching out to you directly to assist you!

review.reviewBody: Great look and feel. Very high quality. The sole might not be what you expect. THey are rock hard to walk in. If you have a narrow foot these will not work at all for you. I ended up returning them and going with the Traction Tread Lite #1221. Night and day difference in comfort, fit my narrow foot, and look very similar. They arnt made in the USA which didnt realize and would. I would have paid more for that.
review.name: Great looking boot but...

review.reviewBody: I dunno.. I bought these about a month ago and I really want to love these boots. I know they take some getting used to along with some TLC. Personally, I like them more with wear than I do brand new and I know that takes some time, so I’m working them in but man it’s taxing. I bought these in store after getting measured and the overall fit feels right but I can’t wear them for more than an hour or two without getting blisters. They’re improving (slowly) over time but the notion that these should be ready to go for the price does cross my mind often. Today (less than 1-month in) one of the laces broke, which seems a bit soon for quality boots and of course I can’t find the laces anywhere; this is somewhat frustrating. I’ll keep working on these, but I hope some relief is in sight, the boots look great.
review.name: Struggling
comment: Hi! I am sorry the break in period has been rough. I will reach out to you directly regarding the laces and to see if there's anything I can do to help.

review.reviewBody: After unboxing, I was wearing these boots at home to break them in. When I took them off I noticed there was a gap, pushed it a little bit and turned out that leather is not glued properly to the mid-sole. I think that it is unacceptable to ship these kind of product to the customer.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I apologize for the issue you’ve experienced with the boots. This is certainly not the standard we aim for, and I will be reaching out to you directly to address the situation and make things right. We appreciate your feedback and are committed to resolving this promptly.

review.reviewBody: The leather smells of quality.  The style is second to none and they just look good.  However, there's a break in period but for me it took several months to conform to my legs.  I recommend wearing quality socks above the ankle.  I plan to keep these for a long time...may have to have them resole in a year or two
review.name: Great Looking Boots
comment: Thank you for this good review! I apologize the break in period was rough but I am so glad they are working well for you!

review.reviewBody: I have owned most of Red Wing's heritage boots.  I honestly believe that the 1907 is their best.  Note that the 1907 is made on a different, roomier last than the other moc toe boots in the heritage line.  Toe box offers more room without looking goofy.  Also, the included leather insoles make a huge difference in comfort.  I can wear these all day.   The copper leather makes a nice patina with wear.  Just an all-around better boot than even the 875 (which is excellent in itself).  I would love to see them offer this boot (on the 55 last) in a few more colors.
review.name: Red Wing's Best Boot
comment: This is so great to hear! I am so glad you have found comfort in these. Let us know if we can assist further!

review.reviewBody: I’ve have these boots for over a month.  Fit pretty good at first, but took about 3 weeks to fully break in.  They are now broken in and fit perfect.  The quality of the boot is second to none.
review.name: Great Fit
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, minus the rough break in period. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: Heritage quality, fit more narrow than Iron Rangers even with the EE width, still excited to break them in
review.name: Authentic Red Wings at Best Price

review.reviewBody:
I bought these boots about 2 months ago, these boots are the best boots I've ever owned. It took about a week for me to break these boots in. I'm usually a size 9 and 1/2
 I went down a full size to an eight and a half and at first, I thought that my feet would never get used to them.  The secret is you have to be patient, You will get blisters 100%. But once these Boots are breakon in it's game over. They'll fit like a glove. Make sure you get fitted before you purchase them the right way because if you get your normal size they will stretch and they will be too big And they'll look floppy on your feet.  Hope this review helps others purchasing these boots and remember always get a half size to a full size lower than your normal size. You'll thank me later. 🍻
review.name: Classic Moc 1907
comment: Jimbo_1935, thank you for your positive review. We are so happy to hear you are enjoying our product! We look forward to your next visit!

review.reviewBody: I picked up my 1907 Moc-Toes while visiting Red Wing, Minnesota and the Main Street ?Store. I never expected to become a Moc-Toe fan but I am increasing my collection. These boots have some subtle design variations that make the already proper design even better.  I am off on the right foot and expect many happy steps as I go.
review.name: Classic Moc-Toe design is ready to go anywhere
comment: Hey, thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review. We are so pleased to hear that you recommend our products and we are excited to continue serving you in the future. Have a great day!

name: Classic Wide 6in Moc Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
First off I'm a Rekon fan.  They have a great combo of rolling speed and grip for me.  I've used the Dual compound in the 2.6 size for years.  That tire weighs about 850g or so.  It takes a long time to wear out.  And its 60tpi construction is more durable.  In over 5 years of using the Rekon never had a flat of any kind at around 20psi. On the rear extra grip isn't as much of an issue compared to the front.  So last year I tried the original Exo+ in the same 2.6 size for 27.5. for the front.  Loved it.  Had better braking more of a damped feel. Old Rekon Exo+ gets 5 stars.

Went to buy another set of Exo+, found out after the fact there is a new version of Exo+.  It goes from 120tpi to 60tpi like the dual compound and loses the silk shield in the sidewall like the original Exo+ had.  It adds a butyl liner on the bead supposedly to reduce pinch flats. So the sidewall is no different than my dual compound Rekon.  Just received the new Exo+ from Competitive Cyclist (quick shipping always good experience) but the new Exo+ weighs 1010g in the 2.6.  The old Exo+ weighed 870g.  I read an article that said the new Exo+ is only 5% heavier.  No way.  At least for the Rekon the difference is 16% heavier.  FYI, I just got the  3C Max Terra regular Exo Rekon 2.6 and it only weighs 830g.  Will try that up front with the dual compound in the rear.  I'm saving 3/4 of  pound of rotational weight.  I like the Rekon.  I like the 2.6 size which is really about 2.5 as is par for the course for Maxxis.  But I do not like the new version of the Exo+.  The old was much better.

Competitive Cyclist on the item description for the Exo+ says the claimed weight is 741g.  I knew that was way off.  They need to fix that. On Maxxis site they say the weight is 948g.  I should looked at their site first.  But the tire is still a good bit heavier than Maxxis claims
review.name: New Rekon Exo+ much heavier

review.reviewBody: This is my winter sun hat. I use it in combination with lightweight ear warmers. It's adorable, warm and protects me from the winter sun.
review.name: Great sun hat for winter

review.reviewBody: More of a floppy hat then a hiking but very cute. The color is beautiful too.
review.name: walk in the park hat

review.reviewBody: Now I’ll buy a black one. It feels good, looks awesome and blocks the sun!!!!
review.name: Mine is brown+10 years old and still looks great

review.reviewBody: This will keep me warm and sun protected through fall and winter!
review.name: Cute red wool hat

review.reviewBody: Stylish and keeps my face completely protected from the sun. Exactly what I was looking for. I bought two hats, which were packed together with care. They arrived in perfect shape. First time ordering from this company and I will definitely be back and recommend to my friends.
review.name: Great hat, great shopping experience

review.reviewBody:
I really love this hat even more than I thought I might. It truly has a 4" brim, which in New Mexico is required for adequate sun protection when sensitive skin is involved. 
But the best part is how fun it is to wear. I feel fun and elegant wearing it for dog walks and by-passers in cars always smile and wave! I love the color, and I love the chin string to keep the hat on no matter the breeze!
review.name: This hat has it all

review.reviewBody: This hat arrived in great condition.  It has the size of brim I was hoping for and is fun to wear.
review.name: Vivian Hat

review.reviewBody: I just received this in the mail the other day after I decided I need to start taking sun protection more seriously after a skin cancer scare in 2020. I'm hoping this won't be too hot for summers here in Minnesota so I can wear it year-round. I LOVE this hat and the adjustable strap as well as the ability to adjust the inside of the hat to make it tighter around my head.
review.name: If a Perfect Hat Exists, This is It!

review.reviewBody: I've never owned a wide-brimmed winter hat, but I'm so glad I now do! The brim has enough structure that it doesn't fall down into your face, but soft enough to ripple -- it's just right.
review.name: Great Winter Sun Potection

review.reviewBody: I was diagnosed with malignant melanoma and wished to keep up outdoor activities in the winter. My summer hats are not warm enough so I looked for a winter sun hat. I am very pleased with the quality of this hat and the protection it gives me. I have a small head and the crown is adjustable. I also love the chin strap as it tends to get windy where I live. I have recommended this hat to a friend and would purchase from this company again!
review.name: Excellent Product

name: Vivian Hat - Women's

review.name: Paper thin not worth the heavy price

review.reviewBody:
very nice comfy and warm, light fleece.
the hood is great when you need it.
the chest pocket is small, but enough to fit glasses in.

They are missing a couple of things to make it a home run.... it needs thumb loops and the pockets could have been sew to the jacket on the inside, thus creating two very large inside pockets.  A hem cord would've also been nice, but it's a tad on the long side and fits closely, so that's not a big deal.

Overall I'm glad I got this jacket.  Gear from Rab seems to be pretty decent.
review.name: almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
I have three pair of these socks. I have both black varieties and love them. Nice thin, good lookin sock for summer riding on my spesh. 

Unfortunately I’m giving it a three because the yellow one I bought was completely different in fit. The tube is double knitted with a yarn-like material to give that striped aesthetic, but the yarn frays easily, and is not as stretchy, so it’s actually difficult to get around your heel.

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Really comfy, light, and stable for trail running.
True to size. 
Lots of cushion for distance training, perfect for hiking to.
review.name: Great shoes.

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I walk my dogs in grass on our property. My hiking books continually soak in the morning dew and I was tired of wet soggy feet. I've had these for weeks and they are fantastic! My husband has a pair also and the only issue is he tends to wear them all day (in the heat) and boy do they stink. If I could only convince him to change his shoes once the dew is gone. I don't think you'll be disappointed. Very comfortable. I took an entire size small than my normal hiking boots (from an 8 to a 7) but my husband was able to wear his normal size.
review.name: Great waterproof shoes

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These trail runners are amazing, my feet feel great. They haven't gotten wet and they also don't sweat..  worn about 6 times so far and on mountain trails.
Love them
review.name: Best I have tried

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have 2 other pairs of Thundercross shoes which are not gore-tex fit great and are comfortable with laces staying put. This pair is different. The tongue is shorter and does not stay in place but scoots down no matter how tight I make it. When going on long walk I have to re cinch laces tighter numerous times as it keeps loosening and tongue moves farther under laces.
review.name: Laces don't stay tight possibly defective
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m loving this shoe and it may become my new go to over the XA pro 3D V9. It’s much lighter and rolls over effortlessly. The toe box feels more refined as well. I’m recommending it to everyone who asks.
review.name: Might be better than XA pro 3D V9

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m 63, and purchased these runners for a holiday in the U.K.  They are a cross between a runner and a hiking shoe, and they offered maximum cushioning for my joints. They are so comfortable, and I’m convinced I was able to walk further, and longer because of these shoes. Being waterproof was an added bonus.  If I could change one thing, it would be to lose the lightening bolt around the shoe. A solid black shoe with black sole, would be perfect for travel.  I know that’s not what these were necessarily intended for, but EVERYONE in Europe, and the U.K. seem to be wearing running shoes for touring around.  Even in the evenings. It would be great to have a shoe like this that also went ok with dress pants. I hope Salomon will consider this for the future.  This isn’t a criticism, but a suggestion. I love these shoes!
review.name: So Comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife and she immediately began wearing them to break them in. Comfortable right out of the box. Excellent traction and the goretex lining does keep feet and socks dry. They don’t allow sand to penetrate fabric as other models do
review.name: Comfortable and dust/sand repellent

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love how this shoe fits. Right out of the box its comfortable; stable in the midfoot and a bit wider in the toe box. Plenty of rocker makes for a great ride and although you're sitting on a lot of foam, you never feel terribly high off the ground. Non-mesh upper is not super breathable but very warm and therefore my go-to cold weather shoe. Thick lugs also make it plenty rugged for snow.
review.name: Awesome Winter Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes because my feet were getting wet and toes feeling crunched and cold when competing and teaching on grass. So very happy I did!!!  My feet stay dry and comfortable. Best shoes.
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace my very old Solomon hiking shoes. These are so comfortable and have great grip. I love them! Just what I wanted.
review.name: Love!

name: Thundercross GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought for myself even though it’s a women’s, I love the color and fit, the warmth is perfect.
review.name: Good for men and women

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have taken this bag camping twice. First time had mild night temps in the 40s and was never chilled; opening the bag a bit solved any overheating. Just got back from the second outing where the temps unexpectedly dropped to 19F. There was frost in the tent and on the bag but I was completely warm and dry. Plenty of room inside, though I could use a little less length, as my feet sometimes get chilly because I’m so short I can’t reach the bottom of the bag to warm it up. Great shoulder season bag. Very satisfied with this purchase.
review.name: Warm down to 19 degrees

review.reviewBody:
This bag is well made and warm. The colors are fun. It is bulky though. My biggest complaint is that the zippers sit right at your cheek, and I tend to fidget a lot. Every time I needed to slip out a hand to check my phone or get a sip of water, it was a struggle to get zipped back in and all the cold air got in. The zippers slip down a little if they're not all the way up. For this reason only my shoulders were cold.

It's a good budget bag for car camping though. If you're backpacking multiple nights you might want something more streamlined.
review.name: Warm but bulky

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Our daughter received this for Christmas and slept outside the same night. It was about 20 degrees Fahrenheit and she said she was toasty warm. She is 5’9” and said there was room for several more inches in the bag.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great warm sleeping bag for cold weather camping in Maine. I stayed super warm and cozy. I would definitely recommend to friends!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My gf loves the sleeping bag. She tried this past weekend even do it was a warm night it was comfortable.
review.name: My gf loves the sleeping bag.

review.reviewBody: Exactly what we expected. A warm, high quality bag to keep toasty warm on cold camping nights. Love the women's cut of the bag.
review.name: Warm and well made women's bag

review.reviewBody: The product is warm and light. It also is a very good fit for my size of 5'9. I like that about it. I do not like the fact that it does not fit in the bag well. My husband got the male version and it is rated for lower temperature and it fits in the bag it came with no problem. I should have gone with that one. Hope this helps someone.
review.name: Meh

review.reviewBody: I am 5’5” and purchased the long, absolutely no regrets! We have now camped in the desert as well as the sierras and this bag was perfect for both. I tend to sleep cold and never had a complaint in either climates! Also, I love how easy this zips into the men’s trestles bag. My boyfriend and I were both very happy with our bags.
review.name: My favorite bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my backpacking trip in Dolly Sods, WV. It kept me warm. I wish it could be compressed just alittle smaller.
review.name: So cozy!

name: Trestles 15 Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic - Women's

review.reviewBody: LOVE these boots! So comfortable, easily adjustable, and super cute too. I wore them in the snow all last winter, and they’re still in great shape.
review.name: Love them!!
comment: Yay! So happy to hear it. Thanks for your review.

review.reviewBody: I don't love these.  The outer fabric rips easily and is tearing away from the seams.  The toe box is a little too narrow for thick socks and the loop around the top makes getting them on and off a nightmare.  The only pair of chaos I've ever actively disliked.
review.name: I don't like these.

review.reviewBody: These are great lightweight and waterproof boots for hiking through the woods with my dog. The only hiccup I had was both back loops for the getting the boots on broke at the same time, 3 months later :(
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody: These were not waterproof and my feet got really cold.  I'm in the PNW, so not extreme weather (except for the rain!).   I was pretty disappointed.
review.name: Not as expected :(

review.reviewBody: These boots are so lightweight! Heavy winter boots always cause pain in my troublesome hips, but these are so light that I can walk for miles in them without any soreness! Despite how light they are, they’re still very warm. They kept my feet (which get cold easily) warm throughout the bitter winter in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula. I usually wear a size 7 in Chacos, but I ordered a size 8 in these so that I could wear thick socks with them.
review.name: Warm and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Comfy, lightweight, great Chaco arch support, stylish…..love these boots.
review.name: Lightweight waterproof ankle boots.

review.reviewBody: Really great boot and lightweight. Can't wait to wear them camping.
review.name: Definitely recommend.

review.reviewBody: I love these boots, I have two pairs. They aren’t as cushioned as some winter boots, more like a light weight tennis shoe. They are waterproof but with limits. Definitely not a boot for rain or wet snow/slush. They do fine in a more dry powdery snow. I have narrow feet so the style works well for me, I can see how reviewers with a wider foot might not agree. My only complaint and it’s a rather big one, is that the sole wears out in a few months. I’ve had hiking boots and winter boots last YEARS. These are a one season boot. I’ve worn them from late October to early May and with daily dog walks the sole is completely worn down on the heel, much more so than a running shoe or tennis shoe would be with the same amount of wear. It’s hard to justify buying a new pair of winter boots every year, it feels really wasteful. If Chaco could please do some work to redesign the sole to last more than a few months, I’d gladly buy another pair.
review.name: Love em’ but they don’t last
comment: We greatly appreciate your feedback.  Please feel free to give us a call at 888-211-1908 if we I can help

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these boots in black and I'm so happy that I did. They are not only soft and warm, but they are super light. Some other boots are super heavy when you wear them but NOT THESE :) I also really appreciate that they are true to size. I was worried about having to buy a size up and having to return them because they were too big. If you're even considering buying them... Just Do It. You won't regret it!!
review.name: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
comment: So happy to hear it!  Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Excellent Chaco comfort, and just what I needed. They can get hot though, which I guess is not a bad thing in the current winter weather. Just know that when wearing them inside, you don't need heavy socks!
review.name: A little too warm, but still great!
comment: Thanks so much for your great review!

review.reviewBody: These shoe covers have kept my feet warm down to the upper 30's on a chilly winter day.  They stay in place well once you get them situated properly over your cleats (I use SPDs).  I highly recommend them for quality and warmth.
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody: I wore these yesterday during 32 miles in temps of 25-28 degrees. No insoles in shoes because was not room, had on heavy wool socks, and plastic barrier bag over socks. My toes got cold pretty quick. Not freezing, but very cold. I have returned for credit.
review.name: Nice construction

review.reviewBody: As other reviews indicate, sizing runs small.  Too small.  I usually get a large for my size 9 - 9.5 shoes.  Size large for this product may fit if you really want to struggle with them, but why pay this much and have to perform hi jinx to ear them, when in time that effort might compromise the quality of the seams and fabric? I never used them, because there seemed no point.  I will try an XL, but only because I am crossing my fingers.
review.name: Castelli Estremo

review.reviewBody:
As other reviews mentioned, these run small, so I ordered two sizes larger (XL) than the size chart indicated (M).  I tried to pull them over my Lake size 42 MTB shoes and after 15 minutes I managed to get one of them on.  Getting the zipper up the back took another 5 minutes.  I was very concerned I was going to tear the fabric, the zipper stitching , etc., as I had to pull very hard to stretch the material over my shoe's tread, over my relatively small ankles/calves, etc.

I ordered a Large pair for my wife, even though the size chart indicated a small or medium.  I tried the XL size on her shoes, and it went with amount of effort you would expect, but the openings in the bottom for the shoe treads don't line up with her smaller shoes because the XL is definitely designed for a larger shoes like mine.  Trying the large size on her shoes was roughly the same nonsense as I had trying the XL on mine - very difficult to get it on over the shoe treads.  

Too bad, because the material does appear to be excellent in terms of insulation, and I have no doubt these would keep us warm.  Maybe on a road shoe they might slip on more easily, but on an MTB shoe with big treads, forget it.
review.name: Great concept, poorly executed

review.reviewBody:
I have long battled cold toes, and though I had figured out the rest of the gear, my feet were always cold.  I even went so far as to buy winter road boots, still cold.  Then I bought these shoe covers, and combined with toe warmers (on the top of my toes, strangely they don't work on the bottoms at all for me) my feet and toes are finally warm.  I've ridden in temps down to 23F, but the 'feels like' was in the teens.  They are warmer than the boots I bought so now I wear my normal road shoes with these on.  Love them, they just work.
Size 13/47 shoes and XXL fits tight but not too tight.  Seems accurate.
review.name: Absolutely Great Shoe covers

review.reviewBody: These are very warm shoe covers and are of a nice material except for the underside of the toe,after just one ride that portion had a small tear where I missed clipping in which I know everybody probably does every now and then kind of made me sick after what I paid for them so I cut a small piece of intertube and used gorilla glue to patch each one of the toe areas I believe this will help to keep it from tearing further.Castelli needs to make the toe area out of a more durable material.One side note if you wear sidi shoes that have closable vents under the toe area be aware that the vent will eventually wear a hole in the underside of the toe area,I fixed this by removing the entire vent and sealing up with a piece of duct tape works much better.
review.name: Kind of disappointed

review.reviewBody:
I wear size 47 shoes (with dual boas) and size XXL Estremo fit really nicely on them: no wrinkles but not excessively tight.

So far have used them down to 29F and they have worked fine, not even a hint of chilly feet despite wearing just DeFeet wool blend Cyclismo socks on my feet.  It may help that I use orthotics which block the air vents in the soles.

Next question is how high the temp can be without having my feet get too hot in them!  The temp usually rises quite a bit while I am out on my morning rides.

Alas the Estremos are available only in black, wish Castelli would make them in brighter colors for visibility on gloomy winter days.  Got some USB-rechargeable blinking red LED lights with clips which I fasten to the tops of the Estremos at the back: EverLight FX by Apace, sold on Amazon for $25 a pair, LONG battery life on flash mode.
review.name: Warmest shoe covers I've found

review.reviewBody: I ordered a set of medium shoe covers as they should have fit my shoe (men's shoe size 41.5-42). They easily got over the my road shoes, but are too tight to be able to zip up on the calves if wearing anything other than a super thin sock. Not feasible for riding with winter tights. Might want to order a size bigger if you are at the upper end of the size
review.name: too tight on calf

review.reviewBody: I wear a size 45 shoe, I'm a slender guy, and yet I could not even get the size XXL to fit over my shoe, no matter how hard I stretched it.  I even tried to pull it over the shoe without the shoe on my foot.  Ridiculous.  This seems to be a theme with Castelli products.
review.name: Too small
comment: My shoes are 47's, and per Castelli's sizing chart I got XXL's.  They work fine for me, even fit nicely over my shoes' dual BOA's.

review.reviewBody:
These are the warmest shoe covers I have found.  With the aid of wool socks, they keep my feet warm even in temperatures in the 30's.  I haven't ridden in temperatures below freezing so I can't rate them for colder temperatures.

I have the largest size and they fit my shoes (47.5 extra wide) fine.  The zipper in the back of the cover makes them easy to put-on over my shoes.  They allow more than enough room for my cleats.

I haven't found them to last any longer, or less long, then other brands.  I can usually get one season+  from them.   I live in Southwest Washington state and generally need them 
late fall unit early spring.

If they have a disadvantage, it's probably their high price.  I believe it's worth the price for the comfort they provide.
review.name: WARM

name: Estremo Shoe Cover

review.reviewBody: Confortable fit and no leaking!  The hose is a bit long - tends to flop around.  The reservoir is actually easier to fill and close than my prior hydration vest.  Steep price esp for not including the front soft flasks.  Tight fit - and I followed the size guidelines. I have trouble wrangling my phone, gels, car key (which is admittedly a bulky key), tissues and a soft flask into the front pockets. On my old bag, I would have two soft flasks in front — can’t do that with this one.
review.name: Great bag, but a little tight

review.reviewBody: I finally found a race vest is perfect for the petite woman. The vest doesn't fall off my shoulders like other vests do. It's also very light and I love the waterproof phone pocket
review.name: Awesome fitting race vest

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this running vest. It’s light weight and super breathable. These qualities are a must for us south Texans! I purchased 2 flexible water bottles to use in front pockets vs using the provided bladder.
review.name: Perfect for running in the heat!

review.reviewBody:
This vest does not fit according to the size chart. It was expensive so I was sure to measure as instructed and fell right in the middle of the range for XS. Discovered on first run it is too tight and had bruising on my ribs.
Also took forever for shipping.
Very disappointed I spent all this money for this product and have the wrong size
review.name: Poor fit- size guide was inaccurate
comment: Hello and thank you for your review of our Pinnacle 12 Liter Women's Hydration Pack. I deeply apologize for this sizing issue with yours. Please contact our customer service department at (800) 233-6956 or cs@unitedspb.com and we will assist you further with this matter.

review.reviewBody: The vest fits amazing! I am 213lbs, a size 38DD, 4’11”. The XL fits best!! It does run slightly small so go up if you are bustier. My only complaint is the hydration pack smelled  soooooo strong of a chemical smell. I washed it with soap and it helped with the smell but it was still pretty bad and when I drank the water it tasted like a chemical. I do believe after a few uses that should go away but I only used it one time so far. I would also suggest they go up on the women’s sizes.
review.name: Great fit!!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this pack after a lot of research for a 10-15 liter running pack with enough storage for full day mountain trail outings. This pack is smartly designed with the placement and variety of pockets. I love how large the front pouches are for soft bottles and food, and especially appreciate that there are 2 zip pouches large enough to fit a phone and bulky keys. The back pockets and pouches seem odd at first, but are quite efficient. The right pouch works well for stashing poles points up, or you can stuff a pair of gloves or a layer in it for easy access. There is a smaller pouch that fits a first ait kit well, and the bladder pouch could be used for other items. The zip pouch shape works best if you use small stuff sacks. The stretchy fabric is very comfortable and keeps the pack in place when running. As other reviewers mentioned, determine your size by the bust measurement, not the waist. The waist strap has an inch or 2 that can be tightened down, but the bust number in the sizing chart is the max expansion of the chest strap. While many rumners are anti- hydration bladder, I actually really like the insulated bladder included; the shape does not make the pack bulge when full, the hose has a magnet that keeps it in place, and the bladder provides some back  cushion and shape to the pack. On the cons side, the breathability of the pack material means sweat will permeate the rest of the pack; use stuff sacks to keep items dry like clothing layers or paper maps. My only other gripe is the small size of the velcro closures. They are about 3/4" wide and sit in the middle of the open pockets, which means they pull open easily. The kangaroo side pouches open up mid-run when the pack is full. If the velcro extended the full width of the pockets, I think they would stay closed better without compromising anything measurable in pack weight.
review.name: Great mid-sized running pack

review.reviewBody:
After all the highly rated reviews, and at this price point, I expected better. 

On the bright side, the bladder didn't seem sloshy, the material is really light and comfortable, and the zippered pocket accommodated my phone just fine. I also appreciated that the hidden whistle is anchored deep in one of the zippered pockets, so it doesn't bounce against anything else you put in the pocket (this happens with another vest I have, and the noise is exceedingly obnoxious).

However, this vest needs some improvements:
1. There are no loops to help secure the half-liter flasks you can put in the front pockets. This is an epic fail. The flasks sink down into the pockets as they empty, making is a real pain to pull them back out to take a sip.

2. The angled pocket on the back is probably fine for poles, but terrible if you want to use it for anything else, especially something small like sunscreen--it's open at the bottom, with only a small velcro closure, so items can easily slip out. I hadn't realized this before I took it out on a run, and was glad I heard the thud of my sunscreen hitting the ground when it fell out.

3. Sizing. FWIW, I'm a 32G; sternum measures 31", bust measures 36", so I went with the Small. Should have ordered a Medium. The chest straps are very short, and at full extension, the lower one was extremely tight. So much so that I actually found it a little hard to breathe when I was running and had to release the strap on uphill segments. The straps also sit awkwardly across the chest, and need more room for adjustment vertically.

4. I was out for a long run and had a lot of extra gear and food with me, so all the back pockets were pretty full. I found that items nearer the top of the back pockets were moving around a lot, and it would be nice if there was a way to cinch down the gear storage to eliminate bounce.
review.name: Needs improvement

review.reviewBody: The vaporhowe was the BEST! I tried to find a replacement and this one does not come close. It is awful. The vaporhowe had a big bladder pocket and a big kangaroo pocket and a smaller zip pocket. The zipper pocket did not compromise the size of the big storage pocket (could easily fit a puffy and poles in the big kangaroo pouch) The pinnacle has the pocket for the bladder which is fine, but the kangaroo pocket design is awful. Instead of being a big open pocket like the vaporhowe, the pinnacle pocket is divided into 2 sections. Neither work well. The open pocket is not big enough for a jacket or layer, and to make matters worse the bottom of the pocket is OPEN! There’s a Velcro closure- I guess the idea is you can reach in from the bottom and grab something but the VELCRO DOES NOT STAY CLOSED so anything small falls out.  The other side of the kangaroo pouch has a vertical zipper which is fine but neither pocket is the correct size. Poorly designed. It is the most annoying running vest I have ever tried.
review.name: AWFUL DESIGN
comment: Hello and thank you for your review of our Pinnacle 12 Liter Running vest. I am sorry to see it is not meeting you expecations. Please contact our customer service department at (800) 233-6956 or cs@unitedspb.com and we will assist you futher with this.

review.reviewBody: I have owned my Pinnacle vest for 2 years and have definitely put it through the test with multiple ultras - several 50 milers, a 100k, and a 100 miler. It has proven its durability. So much storage areas and various sized pockets that I can find a place for any running essential. After long runs, I just toss it in the washer therefore it has even lasted through many washing machine cycles. I am not a fan of the insulated bladder it comes with so I replace it with a regular 2L Nathan bladder - I find these to be much easier to fill and MUCH easier to clean as you can turn them inside out. No amount of insulation can survive the AZ heat so it wasn't a feature that was important or beneficial to me. A great vest overall!
review.name: Durable!

review.reviewBody: This pack is comfy and holds everything I need to bring-water, gels, extra layer, small handheld water, phone, snacks-with room to spare.  I rated 4/5 stars only because I wish it had additional straps to tighten it up, it has just the two across the chest, but as my water empties I’d like to pull it up a littler higher.  Overall it’s great!
review.name: Pockets galore!

name: Pinnacle 12L Hydration Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love my Skida headband , but never got a chance to try it out because it’s too small.
review.name: Skida  headband

review.reviewBody: I was able to wear my headband out for the first time today in fairly cold weather for a run as well as a brisk walk and it was great! Kept my ears toasty and I didn't overheat. I was a little worried about the fleecy inside but in the end it was perfect. The design is also quite cute. Always a plus. :)
review.name: Great headband!

review.reviewBody: Love these!  I loved them so much that I got several for Christmas gifts and the recipients love them too.  Material is so very nice!
review.name: So soft and warm!

review.reviewBody: I love this little fleece-lined headband. It's perfect for walking, hanging out by the fire pit at home, and can't wait to snowshoe and cross country ski in it this winter. There are those sunny warmer winter days when you're out working hard on the skis and a hat is too much, and having nothing on your head is not enough. This will be perfect.
review.name: Love it!!

name: Alpine Headband - Women's

review.reviewBody: Got this exact backpack in the mens version for our grade school son. It only lasted a few months. The mesh sides developed holes in from normal use - holding his water bottle.
review.name: Didn't last the school year

review.reviewBody: Based on historical great quality and durability, I would have expected better interior craftsmanship on the stitches/hems/pockets. The seams have ripped after 1yr and expected longer use for price.
review.name: I would not likely by this pack again.

review.reviewBody: The color is not as described and my item was dirty when it arrived. I’m giving it 2 stars for the good.
review.name: Northface Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've used this consistently for sports, dance, and school every year for 10 years. This thing holds up.
review.name: Had Since Fourth Grade - Now a Freshman In COLLEGE

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works for a school backpack
review.name: Great school backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good looking bag pack, made with good quality materials.
review.name: Good bag pack overall

review.reviewBody: I've had this backpack for over a year now. Definitely not waterproof and smaller in size but it's been adaptive to many parts of my life and intuitive in use.
review.name: Used as a school backpack - does the job

review.reviewBody: I used this bag for school and overall it's a fantastic bag lasted me for almost two years and is super great, but is VERY small on the inside. I can barley fit two binders in here, I can't fit a lunch or anything, I do not recommend this bag if you are planning to use it for school. ALSO when full looks very funky.
review.name: yes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like the reviewer above me, my strap broke, but only after a month! I was on my way to work with a laptop, cell phone and not much else and it just broke. I thought North face products were reliable, but this is very disappointing. And since I didnt' buy it at north face I can't bring it back to a north face store to have it serviced. Instead I have to ship it back at my expense.
review.name: strap broke after one month!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this backpack for college (from Dicks sporting goods) and it broke after barely 6 months of use. I never had more than a computer, water bottle, binder, and a few small things in it. Never more than 3-5 pounds. The strap broke and fixing this issue has been incredibly difficult and costly. It's not worth it. I expected much better quality from the North Face. Also the front pocket design isn't great. Causes the bay to tip over a lot and it's really annoying.
review.name: Strap broke after 6 months

name: Vault 21.5L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shirt offers excellent warmth thanks to its soft, insulated lining, making it perfect for chilly days. The exterior is both durable and stylish, and it has held up well even after several washes. I appreciate the practical pockets for storing small essentials. Whether I’m hiking or just out and about, this shirt provides great comfort and functionality. If you're looking for a reliable and versatile shirt for cooler weather, the
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice shirt, good quality. But, I didn’t read it was a lined shirt. If it’s sunny and wet you will regret this purchase.
review.name: It’s a lined shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Its look nice, very confort, the color and quality
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very good quality, fit is good,not bulky soft to touch
review.name: Good quality product,

review.reviewBody: I really like this shirt. Best feature is the lining. The snaps vs buttons are handy, too. Will purchase another.
review.name: My winter go-to shirt.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very good shirt-jacket, but do not expect it to be “lined” with soft fabric like fleece, or quilted cotton. The lining is a thin synthetic material that is not very soft. The shirt-jacket is a quality, lightweight item that I enjoy wearing, but it is just not what I was expecting based upon my reading of the description. Perhaps it’s my mistake.
review.name: Thin, synthetic lining is not soft

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like all Columbia shirts that I've purchased the fit is perfect for my needs. I'm just shy of six feet two hundred and fifteen lbs and purchased an XL, this lanndroamer shirt is perfect! with the liner it works as a shirt jacket in cool weather or an extra layer in cold weather. Works great over a t shirt or layered over a light sweatshirt. I like the color (dark mountain) fit and finish.
review.name: Great lined shirt!

review.reviewBody:
#BackcountryGearhead

This Columbia Shirt is seriously durable and easy to get on and off with the snap button style. I really like the color Stone Green because it is an earth tone and blends with a lot of my other clothing. The fit is pretty true to size and not a slim fit, allowing some freedom of movement. I also liked the pocket options for hiking. Overall I can see this shirt working well for backpacking, camping, or outdoor work environments because of the durability of the material. The medium fits well.
review.name: Rugged and Stylish

name: Landroamer Lined Shirt - Men's
