review.reviewBody: This is my second Synchilla jacket and I love this jacket. It's the perfect weight for all kinds of weather, yet breathes well when I am out walking vigorously!
review.name: Synchilla jackets are the best!

review.reviewBody:
I see this jacket being put to a lot of use! The fleece material is nice and warm. I bought a size larger than usual since that's all they had left. It fits bigger on the shoulder, while other places fit okay.

I gave these 3 stars, because Backcountry sent me a product that had dust, smelled like someone had attempted to clean it, and had someone else's blond hair on it. They're out of stock on everything, so it's not like I can exchange it - but thought they'd at least do a quality check before reselling their returned products. Disappointing experience.
review.name: Good jacket but issues with Backcountry

review.reviewBody: Pretty much sold out at Patagonia stores in CA. The jacket is very stylish and functional. I bike most of the time, I find it better than windbreaker in the winter season.
review.name: Stylish and warm

review.reviewBody: I loved the look/fit/feel of this when it came in.  I have other colors of this item (black, oatmeal, blue, etc.), and have washed/dried them for years without issue.  I didn't wear it for a while after I bought it, but when I did and had to wash it a major problem arose.  After washing in cold water and drying on low like I always have with other color Interceptr pullovers, the Mol color one shrunk so badly my girlfriend who is half my size can wear it without it looking big.   A mens size XXL shrunk down to a womens size S/M.  I have been buying Kuhl stuff for years, and I know some of their older stuff had this issue, but the 1/4 Zip Interceptr hasn't had this issue until now.  I would ask for a refund, but I know they won't accept a worn/washed item this far past purchase.  Buyer beware.
review.name: Mol color shrinks badly after first wash

name: Interceptr 1/4-Zip Fleece Jacket - Men's

I tried a M but it was too small around the mid-section and then I tried a large and it was overall too big. I’m 5’7” and ~160lbs. Quality and color were great but unfortunately had to return.

review.reviewBody: A little big/long but overall warm and cute , really warm ! And light weight

comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.
 
We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm very happy with this flannel jacket and the price!! Very soft, lightweight, great for layering. I bought the XL it is roomy and big enough for a layer underneath. Looks very good with my Marmot pom-pom beanie! Don't miss out!
review.name: Cute comfy flannel kljacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like plaid jackets or shirts, I have had the opportunity to buy some of them from this brand and to this day I have been a little fascinated. I already have the green one of this model, so I made another purchase in a different color. Of course, I can say that it allows you to wear any coat or whatever you want underneath. In my case, I use it accompanied by a sweater or hoddie to feel warmer. It's a little loose which is ideal for me since I don't like to feel too tight.
review.name: Perfect for the season

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfy and I love the deep pockets. I am still figuring out my sizing with Marmot, and definitely could have gone with a small on this rather than the medium, but I’m enjoying the oversized fit. Only complaint is the product description mentions a “hidden” interior pocket that … must be very hidden because I can’t find it.
review.name: Great coat! Runs a bit large

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket, good quality, fits well. Usually between S and XS and got an XS which worked well.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the most comfortable jacket I have ever worn.
review.name: Great jacket

name: Lanigan Flannel Coat - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just got my jacket.It is nice, surprising  keeps me warm and the color is beautiful. It is a right size, very handy for a kind of cold weather. Definitely I recommend it .
review.name: Comfortable and cute jacket, good and warm quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket , I like it's interchangeable and it's comfy and warm
review.name: Laurelwoods II jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pair! It’s my go-to fleece! The color of the fleece is more of an olive green, which I love. I thought it would be brown based on the photos
review.name: Perfect duo

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super cute and comfy. However it runs LARGE! I am normally a medium in tops and ordered a small based off the other reviews. The small was quite large on me. It felt more like a true size large. I like the oversized look so it works out for me. I love that you basically get two jackets for the price of one. The fleece is super cozy and a bit less oversized than the windbreaker. Overall I'm pretty happy with this purchase!
review.name: Super cute but runs LARGE

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this jacket for my sister in law for Christmas. She was so excited when she received the jacket. She loves how warm the inner layer is. She also loves how versatile the jacket is!
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this product for my friend's sister. Because her sister liked it so much, she recommended it to her sister as well. So, because the product was liked so much, two people from the same family ordered this jacket.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality. Warm but not too warm. Material is a little more windbreaker-y than I thought it would be but I still like it.
review.name: Thumbs Up

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the size and the color, is modern and easy to wear.
review.name: PRACTICE TO WEAR

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like this jacket, stylish and serves the purpose of keeping you warm
review.name: Awesome Jacket

review.reviewBody: A new Mountain House meal and one of my newest favorites! If you're craving Indian food with a little heat and lots of spice this is it! I love how warming a meal this is, especially on a cold ice climbing day or a chilly camp morning. You're going to love this filling and delicious new meal!
review.name: Yes you can have quality Indian food wherever!

review.reviewBody: Just got this before a recent outing. Outstanding! Great flavor add a bit of habanero was perfect.
review.name: Great flavor

review.reviewBody: I can't wait for it to come out in a # 10 can for food storage.
review.name: Perfect flavor...!

review.reviewBody: Main food source while hiking the Appalachian Trail
review.name: Life saver

review.reviewBody: I purchased this about 3 weeks ago.  prepared a package last night and as usual the meal was great. just the right amount of spiciness. I should have bought more.
review.name: Quick and Easy

review.reviewBody: It tasted a little less Indian than I expected and was a little too spicy, but overall was quite good.
review.name: Tasty but spicy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This really is just okay.  I wanted to wear Scuba and i won't be doing that.  The hood is ODD
review.name: It's okay

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love this shirt, and it was super comfortable and well fitting. But the extremely prominent logo on the sleeve was too much for me. I didn't want to be a walking advertisement. Sadly I am returning.
I like this top as it protects me from sun and dries super fast if it gets wet.  The sleeves are long and protect the backs of my hand from the sun.  The top has a loose flattering fit.
review.name: Sun protection top

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Roomy fit. A little long in the sleeves. Love the color.
review.name: Nice Hoodie

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just purchased this PFG hoodie in a pinch for sun protection this weekend. Love the color, fit, and style. However, the internal seams are a mix of flat and raised. The seams that run  along your arms and down your side are raised and this isn’t as comfortable as a flat seam. I kept the shirt, but will just wear it inside out.
review.name: Want to love

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good, relaxed fit. Super comfortable material. Beautiful color. Very lightweight.
review.name: Great shirt to keep cool for summer hikes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this item for all day boating trips and I am so happy I did because it provides amazing sun protection.
review.name: Sun safety!

review.reviewBody: It's a pretty shirt. Fits well and I don't get too hot wearing it. I wear hiking for sun protection. Just wish the hoodie wasn't so loose. It blows off easily when it's breezy.
review.name: Nice sunshirt

review.reviewBody: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE these hoodies!! I have it in several colors, and they are a staple in my beach vacation packing. Perfect for boating too. Lightweight, stylish, beautiful drape, cool colors AND sun protection all in one. I keep buying them because I love them so much! Please never stop offering these awesome hoodies!!
review.name: Perfect Beach/Boating Hoodie

name: Tidal Hooded Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's

description: Buy the Mountain House Beef Stew online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Beef Stew
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Beef Stew online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Of all the MH foods, this one is our "go to" favorite.
review.name: Our favorite on the trail.

review.reviewBody:
Love it. I don't add quite as much water as indicated and like it better that way because it isn't as soupy.
Flavor is a 10/10.
review.name: Delicious

review.reviewBody: Possibly the best meal available in your range.Really tasteful and hearty.
review.name: Doesn't get any better.

review.reviewBody: We take this on AK moose hunts. Tastes great. Always wondered why I lost so much weight then saw how few calories it has. It’s not “emergency food” if you starve to death while eating it. Labeling needs work. It should be easy to determine allergens. This is not obvious.
review.name: Tasty. Quick and easy to prepare.

review.reviewBody: I am not a fan of peas but at the end of a day of backpacking in the high Sierra Nevadas, this really hit the spot. Having a hot and flavorful meal can't  be beat. I was suprised at how tasty it was.
review.name: Flavorful and a great comfort in cold weather.

review.reviewBody: I had decided to start purchasing long term meals and wanted to assure myself it was the right brand. I tried the beef stew and have bragged on it to everyone. Hands Down the best flavors ever. So now you can see what brand I have chosen
review.name: Beef Stew 1st. time

review.reviewBody: We bought these just for peace of mind in case something happens. They’ve all gone into our 72 hour kits. I know they’re delicious from tasting them before and I know we’ll enjoy them if we need to. Something good and comforting will go along way in an emergency. The shelf life will probably outlive us though. Too bad!
review.name: I’d like to taste it but hope I never do!

review.reviewBody: Great taste, affordable, easy to use! A perfect comfort food! Well done again!
review.name: A classic winner!

review.reviewBody: Very good and more than enough for one person!!!!!!
review.name: Good meal!!

review.reviewBody: Excellent meals and quick friendly service.   Thank you!
review.name: Excellent Freeze Dried Long Life Meals

name: Beef Stew

review.reviewBody:
I really like the fit/finish of these. I typically wear XL in pearl Izumi, and XL in these was a bit tighter, but realistic, unlike Castelli. Unfortunately, the fabric not immediately surrounding the crotch, so on the outside of your thighs and all of your legs is see through. You can see it in the picture without the model. The mannequin's thighs are white and very visible. So were mine... 
Good news is that you won't be flashing anyone as the panels around the crotch/butt are opaque. I'm not comfortable showing off like that.
review.name: Good fit/quality but kinda see through

review.reviewBody: We can?t wait to get out more with our Kid Carrier. Our toddler loves it and if she sees it out she demands to be put in it, even if it?s just to sit in the living room to watch TV. It?s very comfortable for all involved and we love how adjustable it is. We know it got our toddlers stamp of approval after she fell asleep 15 minutes into our hike and slept for the duration of it. We love how easy this makes it for us to get outside and not have to lug a stroller, meaning we have more room in the car to fit our dog so she can come along!
review.name: Great product
comment: Exactly as expected. This pack is very comfortable and has a wide range of adjustments that can be made. Would recommend for anyone who likes to hike with kids.

review.reviewBody: Very narrow in the larger sizes (10,11,12,13) at D width… which is strange because the weekender width is fine. How the heck does the standard width vary across shoes? Standard width should be a static measurement
review.name: Too narrow at larger sizes
comment: Thank you for your review. Our boots are handcrafted and made on different lasts, which shift the volume of the boot and depending on the size, the width will vary as well. We will pass your comments along to the proper channels to see if more consistency can be found in the widths.

review.reviewBody: Ordered my usual size 13 in Briar. I have a narrow foot (B width) and after inserting a cork bottom SOLE insert they fit pretty good with a little heel slippage. Would not want to wear these without an insert as the insole is flat and hard. These are thick, stiff old school leather boots that do require some break-in which I'm still working on.  So far so good and they look great.
review.name: good looking boot
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, minus the rough break in period. Thanks for the tips and tricks about the break-in! We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: Once broken in very comfy. Well made, you get what you pay for.
review.name: Chukka
comment: Thank you for this great review! We're glad you love them!

review.reviewBody: I Love the purchase I made from you!!!!!
review.name: awesome product

review.reviewBody: Thought I had buyers remorse for a while but then Bam..broke in beautifully. Let me know when the copper becomes available in 10.5. Will buy that one too.
review.name: Fantastic!
comment: This is such a sweet review! I am so glad they ended up perfect for you!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this chukka a few times to try different sizes and widths. Obviously I picked the size that fit. I’m just over two weeks in and my left heel still gets sore like the shoes aren’t broken in. This never happened with my blacksmiths. The difference in construction between the left and the right is noticeable in a couple ways. I can tie the left shoe easily with plenty of shoe lace to use but the right shoe doesn’t give the same amount of room. This is a wide size and the left shoe is definitely roomier than the right which may explain this lacing issue. It just feels weird having one shoe fit so different than the other and I am used to enjoying Red Wings but I’m not sure about these. Hopefully the issue will resolve itself in time.
review.name: Not what I’m used to getting from Red Wing
comment: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear your boots are not performing as expected. We will reach out to you directly to do what we can to assist via email.

review.reviewBody: I have 2 pair of these.  One Sunday got to meeting pair another for everything else.  Had the old pair about 15 years.  I recommend these highly.  Had them resoled and this made the old pair look vintage! Buy this boot!
review.name: Great boot
comment: We appreciate your loyalty and support over the years!

review.reviewBody: I spend a lot of time on my feet at work, with weather warming up this are the perfect pair of boots. Comfortable out of the box and short break in period compared to my other red wings I own. Only downfall is I feel the laces are a bit short, but those can easily be replaced! Another successful purchase in my book.
review.name: Love them!
comment: Thank you for your review!  We're happy to hear your boots are comfortable and can pass along the lace suggestion to the appropriate team.

review.reviewBody: These have held up well after a year of daily abuse.  The soles could probably use a replace and I have a couple stitches that need attention, but I'm confident if I take care of these, I'll have them for life.  Break in was a nightmare for me personally, but once I broke em, they are as comfy as slippers.  Nice bonus, I get lots of compliments on them.
review.name: Best work boots I've ever owned.  Made in the US.
comment: SanDiegoDude, Thank you for leaving this great review. We are happy to hear you are satisfied with our product. If anything comes about in the future, please let us know.

review.reviewBody: Have had for 2+ months and have been wearing 6 days a week. Very stylish and comfortable and fit just right.
review.name: Style and Comfort
comment: Thank you for this kind review! We hope we continue to be apart of your day to day.

name: Work Chukka Wide Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tube style neck warmer by APEX is great! It is soft and stretches to fit your neck and face. I used this while hunting and skiing to keep my face warm and protect from the harsh winds. This is hands down a great piece of clothing to add to your winter attire!
review.name: Comfortable, stylish and works great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband is always outdoors and uses neck warmers in the chilly months to keep warm. The inside of this neck warmer was very soft and has a fleece lining to help keep you warm. The outside has a durable material that is waterproof which is perfect for rain or snow. Overall, this product is very durable and warm and my husband is wanting to purchase more colors in the future.
review.name: Durable and very warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a relatively small head and it was a good fit. It was comfortable and didn’t get too hot. I don’t see myself using this in the winter to protect from the cold but overall great warmer. I think this would look better on men but thats just my opinion.
review.name: Noce warmer
comment: Thank you for the your feedback on the APEX Tube! We hope it continues to keep you warm and comfortable throughout the chillier months ahead.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This came at the perfect time because it has been so cold. Keeps the face so warm and dry, fits well and so easy to lift and drop. Great if you are on a hike.
review.name: Warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This neck warmer fits comfortably and is breathable with high quality material. It’s ver warm but will not overheat while skiing during the winter.
review.name: Breathable neck warmer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The neck warmer is made of high quality durable materials and is very comfortable. I like the design on it. The only downside is that it was a bit too tight.
review.name: Great neck warmer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son loves this. He plans to use this to wear when he ones duck hunting and in the snow. It keeps him warm and it is easy for him to breathe. This is very good quality and easy to wash and keep clean. My son loves the pattern of it and the soft feeling of it on his face. Definitely recommend.
review.name: Keeps your face warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great neck warmer. Fits really snug and the material on the inside is soft and warm. I’ve already used it a couple of times to help me during windy days. I’ll be using this in my upcoming ski trips!
review.name: Great prodcut

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super cute neck warmer. It is really silky on the outside (and waterproof) and nice and fuzzy on the inside. It is very thin so easy to pack to take with! It isn’t that cold yet where I live so I haven’t been able to use it outside but inside it is very cute and durable!
review.name: Sleek thin comfy neck warmer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Apex tube is extremely warm and comfortable,  easy to breathe in when outside . Great product,  very durable,  exact fit. It is also easy to adapt for whatever you need this for to keep warm in the winter .
review.name: It's really warm and comfortable

name: Apex Tube

review.reviewBody: tTypically I wear Burton AK and I'm looking for similar quality with a bit more style, so I wanted to love this jacket. But from a technical perspective, there's one major flaw for me that will keep me reaching for my AK everytime-- there's no elastic on the wrists of this jacket and no sleeve for your hand. Wind/snow just shoots right up the wrist. I would have expected they'd considered that detail given the brand name, but I guess not?
review.name: No elastic on the wrists

review.reviewBody:
Thought this jacket would be great - from the picture, it looks slouchy in a good way.  It is not - thought it would be a little longer in back, but it actually the same length all around. The whole jacket gives a marshmallow-like look and is shorter than anticipated. For reference, I'm 5'8" and am a small.  Also, the quality just didn't seem comparable to similarly priced brands (this is really just based on feel since I never wore it on the mountain - the fabric felt very thin, but maybe it's just a high tech fabric that is lightweight). Finally, didn't like the idea of not having venting under the arms (just a personal preference). On the positive side, it did feel like a warm jacket, and the blue color is very pretty. 

Really wanted to like it- there is really room for more fashion forward designs at this price point, but they are hard to find.  Important to note that the backcountry gearheads were super helpful.
review.name: Wanted to like it

name: Waterproof Insulated Puffy Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Aeroe Handlebar/Front Fork Spider Cradle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have not used any other handlebar cradle, before I was attaching a drybag directly to teh handlebar with Voile straps but that solution only worked on my gravel bike. On the FS MTB there are too many cables/hoses for the ghetto solution to work so bought this (because I was buying the rear cradle already anyway).

I am very happy with this. Good capacity and very stable. I put a few wraps of an old tube on the handlebar to create more friction. On a multiday trip, the cradle required re-tightening, started slipping downwards a bit - but easy fix and nothing catastrophic.
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: This is a game changer, have been using 2 of these on the side of the rear rack on my MTB, super stable and means I can still use my dropper post.
review.name: Ingenious Design still use dropper post

name: Handlebar/Front Fork Spider Cradle

description: Buy the Gregory Citro 24L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Citro 24L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Citro 24L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This bag is just what I needed.  The lightweight external frame gives it structure so it doesn’t collapse when lightly packed, and the breathable back makes it comfortable on warm days.  The external zipper pocket is large enough for the things needing easy access, and the internal pocket keeps less-used items neatly organized.  The two external side pockets work well for my large water bottles, and the front stuff pouch works well to keep a rain jacket and baseball cap handy.  The walking stick loop and strap keep mine handy, and the waist belt pockets are a good place for carrying a snack bar and mask.  Overall, the bag is very well constructed.
review.name: Well-constructed with the features I need

review.reviewBody: Overall like the mix of features in this back, it's pretty good all around. A few things I'd change is it would be nice to have one or two of those shoulder strap pockets, I've found the hip pockets won't zip closed with just one hand, and personally I'd like it to be longer or more adjustable. I'm on the tall side and if you look at the model in the photos the waist belt is sitting a good couple inches above his waist which is where it's at for me so I have to over open the shoulder straps if I want the weight on my hips. Even then it's pretty comfortable though.
review.name: Overall pretty good, prob a little short for taller people though

review.reviewBody: Perfect! Perfect daypack size - well ventilated,Ed carries loads well and is well ventilated. Very durable materials
review.name: Perfect Daypack

review.reviewBody: Such an amazing backpack! So many pockets so many pouches, so lightweight keeps my back nice and cool
review.name: My pack pack rules. Wow ♡

review.reviewBody: This is a nice day pack for our family of three. We combined this pack with the Gregory 3 L bladder. My family and I are able to store enough food and water for us to be able to complete day hikes. Side note, when we go backpacking my child likes to use this bag to carry the "important essentials" ie. (snacks, and stuffed animals lol). Overall this is a nice pack if you are looking for a daily hike bag.
review.name: Great Day Pack

review.reviewBody:
What I like:
- the size is right for a day pack
- space for a hydration reservoir
- hip belt pockets perfect for quick access to snacks or other items like keys or phone
- breathable suspension system
- comfortable to wear on long hiking days

What I don’t like:
- there aren’t many pockets on the bag in general and the pockets it does have are somewhat small
- the water bottle pockets on the side are small and you cannot larger water bottles in them

Over all this is a great bag, and I have used it on many hiking trips. There are only a couple things I don’t love about the pack. I would recommend this pack for most people unless they want outside storage on the pack for water bottles.
review.name: Good Day Pack

review.reviewBody: This is a very comfortable pack.  Holds an ice ax well. I have used this on several colorado 14ers. The only thing I don't like is that the water bladder hanger only works for a Gregory water bladder,  so I had to buy a new water bladder just for this pack.
Holds quite a bit of gear. Everything I need for a day pack or even a simple overnight fits easily.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: I hike in AZ and bought this primarily because of the ventilated back panel feature. I can say that it makes a difference, my back stays much drier than the straps and other contact points. Very comfortable carrying the extra water needed for hiking in the desert.
review.name: Love the ventilated back!

review.reviewBody: Good weight, size and fit.  The bottle holders are a bit too far back and hard to access with one hand
review.name: Overall a good price pack

name: Citro 24L Daypack
Citro 24L Daypack

description: Buy the Western Mountaineering Astralite Quilt: 26F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Astralite Quilt: 26F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Western Mountaineering Astralite Quilt: 26F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought a long Astralight for a thru hike in 2020.  Used it for 4 years, hundreds of miles, and dozens of nights on multiple long distance thru hikes.  I never washed it, or treated it gingerly.  I used the hell out of it. My only complaint was that the fill would fall to the sides overnight.  About 2 years in, I accidentally tore a small hole in the foot box because I truly treated it like it was indestructible.  Leukotaped the hole, and still used it for 2 more years afterwards .   Fast forward to 2024.  I sent it into WM for repair and to overfill with down.  WM calls me up and says that they weren’t happy with the quality of their products manufactured in 2020, and that they wanted to send me a brand new Astralight replacement, overstuffed for free!  What a great company.
review.name: WM has the best products/support!

review.reviewBody:
I just bought this and haven’t trail tested it yet, so I will return here when I have to update this. 

However, when doing a TON of research for this I wanted to clarify, because based on some of the reviews here regarding the condensation and the quilt pad attachments, I almost didn’t buy this! However, I’m so glad I did anyways. The company has updated their product since then and the attachments  for the quilt to the pad are now mini buckles, instead of the drawstring toggles that earlier reviews mentioned. Attaching to the pad was very simple and really very easy.

I have also read, and will verify once I go out on trail, that the company has updated the outer fabric covering this quilt for 2021 to resolve the condensation  issue. They are also willing to replace the fabric from earlier quilts under warranty I believe. 

Also, I wanted to specifically mention that I am a plus size gal and this fits very well around me while attached to my neoair pad. It’s hard to tell from the dimensions listed here (hip girth 51”?) but the quilt is plenty wide- I wear a 3x clothes size, for reference.

 Price wise, I have seen a lot of independent reviews mention the cost of this quilt and I believe it’s true that while it is an expensive quilt when compared to others available (thermarest, EE, UCG, etc) this only applies when comparing size of a reg/reg quilt. When going up in width to a reg/wide or even reg/xwide as would be needed in those other brands, the price increases significantly and even more so when increasing the down fill to match WM standards. The products become much more comparable then and WM’s reputation precedes it- hence my decision to make this purchase.

Very happy with initial testing but of course the real test will be on the trail in a few nights. I’ll be back to update!
review.name: Updated for 2021

name: Astralite Quilt: 26F Down

review.reviewBody: Based on the reviews, it doesn't seem like this pack fits anyone well regardless of chest size, torso size or height. I am petite and the water bottle holders say almost above my breasts and under my armpits. It didn't fit my torso which is 15 inches or sit right on my waist. This is not recommended for anyone.
review.name: I love Mystery Ranch packs but this one is no good

review.reviewBody: I took the pack for a spin on a weekend snow camping trip. I was definitely impressed with how comfortable it was to wear! Lots of padding around my hips and the pack fits my torso. I also enjoyed the easy access pouch in the front. The side straps were great to hold my water bottles in. The chest pouches weren't used much this time but I can see it being handy to put my bear spray in during warmer seasons. There are a few things I wish was different. One was that the bottom zippered area is too small. It would be better for me if it was wider so I can pull out my sleeping bag out easier. Second thing was the excess waist straps. I wish there was something to keep them from hanging down as there is a lot of extra strap. Although I really like how I pull forward to cinch. Finally I wish the straps on the bottom front were longer so I can strap on a sleeping mat or snowshoes to them. They're too short. All in all the fact that this pack is so comfortable, I can forgive these little wishes. I would recommend this pack!
review.name: Very comfortable pack!

review.reviewBody: I purchased a small/extra small for my torso size and for hip comfort. I am 5'2", curvy in the hips, smaller chest area but get super sensitive to anything digging in my armpit area. I wanted a pack to last many trips, and have not backpacked up until now. Carried 40-45lbs over 6 days, and loved this pack, infact, the comfort is part of what inspires me to do more trekking, I am so happy I bought this backpack the first time I invested in a pack, well worth the money. I love all the zips and additional pockets on the shoulder straps (I used it for items I needed easy access to during the 6 hour days hiking, like hand sanitizer, 1/2 roll of toilet paper, or snacks, sunscreen, even my hat folded up to fit nicely. The pack was sturdy and buckles/clips/adjustment features worked well. I found places to compartmentalize everything inside so I always knew where things were for fast access. Additional sternum strap is GENIUS and provides comfortable support below the chest area and above. Back cushioning was great. I even used the top of the pack for a day trek, to hold two nalgenes lower on my hips to avoid holding weight on my shoulder, and threw on a cheap 10l daypack on my shoulders to carry raingear and a few snacks.
review.name: Comfort and Durability made trekking a breeze

review.reviewBody: I tried this pack on and no matter how hard I tried with a (female forest firefighter/backpacker) salesperson, we could not get this pack to fit my chest. I am a 36DD. That being said I ended up with a Glacier instead and it was fantastic on a 5 day trip.
review.name: Love the design, doesn't fit a large chest.

review.reviewBody: I love how this backpack is made. Its comfortable and should fit enough things for a few days.
review.name: Womens Bridger 65 black and blue

review.reviewBody: I'm absolutely in love with this bag. The adjustable frame and different sizing IN ADDITION TO the thoughtful design elements that make backpacking as a woman all the easier makes this my instant favorite. The chest strap avoids smashing my boobs, and the waist strap distributes the bulk of the pack's weight to my hips without being awkwardly fitted--so comfortable.
review.name: The Best Bag

review.reviewBody: I am super picky with features and comfort, and this pack checked off all my boxes! It has the most cushioned waist belt I’ve seen, and the chest straps were perfectly positioned. I was between sizes and ultimately sized down which was the right decision. Already took it out and love it!
review.name: Excellent pack!

review.reviewBody: I just took this pack on a 3-day pack packing trip and it did not disappoint! This pack sits great on the hips, and the three sets of straps (waist, chest, and sternum) makes it very secure for a nice, comfortable hike. The pockets and front access were also convenient. If you’re debating whether this pack is worth the extra weight, it is.
review.name: Comfortable and Convenient!

review.reviewBody: We bought both the men's and women's Bridger 65 packs. We have only had the opportunity to use them on a couple of short overnight trips. But so far we love them. They are comfortable, full of features and well constructed. Looking forward to using them on longer trips later this year.
review.name: Comfortable and well made

name: Bridger 65L Backpack - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Pure Pro Heat Ski Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Sadly I loved the idea of these boots but I would not recommend them.
Only one  boot heater ever worked right from the beginning and I only wore them so few times.
I did call about getting them fixed but got the runaround and then of course as ski season is short the warranty was only a year.
As I live  part time in Aspen no one would fix them and and I paid to have them looked at a few times but with no success.
Not reliable in my experience.

review.reviewBody: I had a 2020 z1. Easily the best helmet I've ever had... i used it for almost 20,000mi. The new one has straps that you can't adjust forward or back tension on allowing the helmet itself to slide backwards. So disappointing, a $20 Walmart helmet would fit and protect better than the new Z1
review.name: Lazer wreaked it

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet last month and am so happy that I did.  The only thing that I would suggest to potential buyers is to be certain of the size you need to purchase.  In my case I purchased a large.  I based the sized on my previous helmet which recommended the same size dimensions as the one I purchased.  Unfortunately for me, (I must be an in between head size) the large fits loosely on my head with it adjusted to the smallest size.
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: always preferred the lazer helmets, but they now have no adjustment where the straps come together under the ear. So you can't adjust the fore-aft fit on your head. As it is it reveals more of my forehead than i'm used to.  No way to change it.
review.name: lazer z-1 kineticore

review.reviewBody: This helmet is very comfortable and it fits a ponytail
review.name: Comfortable helmet

review.reviewBody: This is a good helmet, light weight which is key for me. I spend a lot of time in the mountains climbing and I hate having a 300+ gram helmet just pouring sweat on me. The one issue I have with it is my head measures 59cm which Lazer specifies as a large. I have the adjustment wheel moved all the way to the smallest setting and the helmet is still a little loose. So if you are borderline between a medium and large go with the medium size. The helmet vents really well but the front of the helmet is raised  so it looks like there is an 1 1/2 to 2" between the top of your sunglasses  and the helmet. It is a little strange so it would totally be a personal preference item
review.name: Lazer Z1 Keneticore Helmet

name: Z1 Kineticore Helmet

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best paddle board in my opinion. It’s super stable and has many accessories adding to its versatility. Fishing off the board is a blast. The design is fantastic and easy to setup. A little heavy but not excessively.
review.name: Favorite Board

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ours is actually the seafoam color but we love it.
review.name: Bote Rackham

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m loving the new board that I purchased, it’s great on the water and it turns on a time . But the company should make a bottom plug so when ur using it as a SUP it won’t get drag from the bottom, just an idea . But I love it thanks
review.name: I’m loving the new board

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This board is beautiful. First time I took it out I got loads of compliments, questions, and positive feedback on it's features & looks. I paddled a few miles, and the hull in the front not only helps cut through the water with ease, but it displaces any weed that would normally get stuck on my fin and I'd have to remove so it wouldn't drag me. So dual purpose, and probably not intentional but a great addition.
review.name: Paddling in style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent customer service. Very nice sales professionals. Excellent in store service as well. Life long customer now.
review.name: Excellent customer service. Very nice

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have the Apex drive version of the Rackam. During assembly the front mount of the apex drive came loose from the board. This happened with little pressure on the mount. Basically, when leaning the board slight to the side, the weight of the drive popped the fitting loose. In the picture you can see that only a very small amount of the surface actually adhered to the board. I was able to fix it by regluing and putting weight on the fitting as the glue dried/cured. 

At 5'10", I had to move the inflatable seat far enough forward the magnepod fitting is completely covered by the seat. So much for using the magnetic drink cup I bought with the board.

The finish, colors, coordinating paddle, etc..all make for a beautiful finish. I have three other paddleboards (high end inflatables) and this board is as good or better than the others.

I have only used the board once so far, but it seemed to work OK.
review.name: I have the Apex drive

name: RACKHAM GATORSHELL Stand-Up Paddleboard
